entry.title: Re: Revenue posting for Usage based billing
entry.content:
Hello @sheetalsethiya22 

Have a look at Customer and Internal Project Management, Run Revenue Recognition

To summarise, usage-based billing in customer projects only triggers revenue postings if certain prerequisites are met.

You can carry out the following checks:

  1. Ensure the project has a billing element with usage-based billing enabled.
  2. Ensure Actuals are posted to the project. Without actuals, there is no usage to recognise.
  3. The project must carry a valid Revenue Recognition Key.
  4. The Run Revenue Recognition – Projects app must be used to execute revenue recognition.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Unexpected rounding occurs on the condition type TTX1...
entry.content:
Hi @LEI_ZHANG17 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Supporting Foreign Currencies & Japan for more details.

To summarise, the rounding of taxes condition values in public cloud does not depend solely on the condition type rounding rule. In your case with the JPY and condition type TTX1; JPY is defined in SAP standard with 0 decimal places in currency configuration. This means all condition values are first rounded to whole numbers, regardless of the commercial rounding value. As a result:

  • 15,555 x 10% = 1,555.5 is rounded to 1,555, not 1,556. This behaviour is correct and standard for the Japanese Yen in public cloud.

If you need different rounding, please note that this cannot be configured freely in public cloud because currency decimal rules are fixed by SAP localization. The only alternative is to use BadIs which will require some technical configurations, or you request for an influence item.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Advanced valuation - Self-defined grouping rules
entry.content:
Hi @Constant 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Foreign Currency Valuation for more details.

To summarise, the OPRE and OFLB grouping rules are the supported advanced foreign currency valuation in public cloud.

The “self-defined grouping rule” option you saw in the documentation applies to on-premise / private cloud, where customer-specific BadIs can be used. In public cloud such extensibility is not available, and you cannot create additional custom grouping rules.

So, the suggested best practice in public cloud is for you to use OPRE for cleared items and OFLB for open or non-open items. You can adjust Assignment Reference field if you need additional grouping or you make use of separate valuation areas, thereby adhering to the clean-core principle of public cloud.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to cancel supplier invoice document which is crea...
entry.content:
Hello @Lily16 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Evaluated Receipt Settlement  & Invoicing Reversal  for more details.

In public cloud you cannot directly cancel supplier invoices created through ERS in the Cancel Supplier Invoice Document app. What you can do is to:

Reverse the goods receipts that led to the ERS invoice. The system will then automatically generate the reversal of the ERS invoice. You can then verify the reversal document in the Manage Supplier Invoices app.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Need help in implementing "Multiple value selection"...
entry.content:
Hello

The multipleSelection flag only allows multiple single values entered manually, while selectionType: #MULTI_VALUEopens the proper Fiori multi-select value help dialog (checkboxes, ranges).

So just replace the annotation on your MaterialDocument field in Z_I_SELECTION with @Consumption.filter.selectionType: #MULTI_VALUE, and you’ll be able to select multiple values from the value help.

entry.title: Re: Payment Proposal File and Payment Settlement File mis...
entry.content:
To export the detailed list in S/4HANA Cloud, you can download the payment or proposal lists under PDF format from app Display Payment Lists. The same form template is used to generate both payment proposal list and the corresponding payment list.

To view a payment proposal list in the Manage Automatic Payments app, you can proceed as follows:

  1. Switch to the Proposals Processed tab.
  2. Search for the payment proposal that you want to view.
  3. Open the proposal from the search result.
    The proposal is then opened in the Revise Payment Proposals app.
  4. Choose the Export to PDF icon above the Payments table.

You can then download or print the list from your browser as needed.

Please visit Help Portal documentation for the app at Payment Proposal Lists and Payment Lists

I also recommend you to visit our Fiori Library for app Display Payment Lists to know more about the Product's features.

entry.title: Re: How to cancel supplier invoice document which is crea...
entry.content:
@Lily16  The invoice was created automatically by the SAP system because you received goods (this is called ERS)The "Cancel Supplier Invoice" app is designed only for invoices that someone typed in by hand.When you try to use the "hand-typed invoice" tool on a "system-created invoice," it gives you an error.

1. Find and Cancel the Goods Receipt.

   · You need to find the document number for when your team received the goods into the warehouse. This is the "Goods Receipt" or "Material Document."

   · Use an app like "Cancel Material Document" or "Reverse Goods Receipt" to cancel this receipt.

2. The System Will Cancel the Invoice Automatically.

   · As soon as you cancel the Goods Receipt, the SAP system will automatically cancel the ERS invoice for you. You don't have to do anything else to the invoice.

entry.title: Re: SSAM 2410 IOS Branded Client - Blank Screen and App C...
entry.content:
Manish,

Please refer to the 2933065 - SAP Service and Asset Manager - MDK Support Matrix and make sure you have the right combination of components to build your branded client.

If you are going to use MDK 25.6.3, first make sure you have the necessary dependencies setup according to the MDK version.  Run the MDK Dependency Installer and make sure it shows all green.  Then you must be using the correct MDK Plugin-SDK version for the MDK Version.  For MDK 25.6.3 this means using MDK Plugin-SDK version 2505.1.  You should also start with the Branding SDK associated with the SSAM version matching the MDK Plugin-SDK.  So in this case I would recommend the 2505.1 Branding SDK and then using the SSAM metadata version you need.  Be sure to apply all the notes mentioned in the matrix associated with the SAM Metadata version you are using.

To help troubleshoot issues in the branded client, I would recommend setting the Log Settings > Log Level to Trace in the BrandedSettings.json.  This will give you better information in the client log to help narrow down the issue.

Try with the matching combinations and let us know how it goes.

Bill

entry.title: Re: When deploying CAPM app in trial facing error; Insuff...
entry.content:
Hello,

The "InsufficientResources" error during CAPM application deployment indicates that your Cloud Foundry space or organization has reached its allocated resource limits. This commonly happens when the memory quota is exhausted, you've hit the maximum number of allowed application instances, or you're trying to create a service instance that exceeds its limits. To fix this, you can either decrease your application's requested memory in the manifest.yml file or contact your Cloud Foundry administrator to increase your resource quotas hctra

entry.title: Site Reliability Engineering in the SAP Security Landscape
entry.content:
Expectations have changed as businesses move from traditional software delivery to cloud-native platforms like SAP S/4HANA Cloud and SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP). Delivering a product alone is no longer sufficient; value today resides in consistently providing scalable, secure services.

Herein lies the emergence of Site dependability Engineering (SRE), a strategic pillar that ensures scalability, security, and dependability in combination, rather than a passing IT fad.

What Changed from ITSM to SRE?

Let's understand through comparison between Legacy ITSM and Modern SRE Practices.

 

Legacy ITSM

Modern SRE Practices

Focus on reactive issue management

Focus on proactive prevention and automation

Manual ticket-based resolutions

Autonomous incident response and self-healing systems

Silos between Dev and Ops

Shared ownership and integrated pipelines

SLAs defined post-implementation

SLAs, SLOs, and error budgets defined collaboratively upfront

 

The objective of conventional ITSM models was to "keep the lights on." However, the new standards for SaaS and PaaS infrastructures, such as SAP BTP, are client trust and ongoing stability.

SRE is about engineering for predictability, resilience, and trust, not just about keeping systems alive. SRE's 3-fold approach in SAP Settings is as below:

  1. Prevent:
    • Detect weaknesses early with continuous logging, telemetry, and anomaly detection.
    • Perform controlled failure simulations (Chaos Engineering).
    • Security shift-left: integrate threat modelling into the design phase.
  2. Recover:
    • Prepare on-call responders and playbooks for real-time action.
    • Use incident management tools like ServiceNow, integrated with live dashboards.
  3. Optimize:
    • Use root cause analyses (RCA) and error budget tracking.
    • Incorporate learnings into future releases and patch strategies.

Reliability includes not just availability, but also:

  • Correctness
  • Scalability
  • Security
  • Maintainability
  • Resilience

At SAP, this aligns with the CIA triad:

CIA Triad

SRE Correlation

Confidentiality

Role-based access control, audit trails, secure log retention

Integrity

Data validation, tamper-proof logging, secure development practices

Availability

Uptime monitoring, redundancy (DR), automated rollbacks


Causes of System Failure and the Role of SRE:

Unreliability often stems from:

  • Platform updates (e.g., SAP kernel patches)
  • Application changes (custom code push)
  • Infrastructure drift (network/config updates)
  • Database upgrades or downtime

SLOs and error budgets are used to manage the "Speed vs. Stability" balance that SRE introduces because change is unavoidable. This guarantees quick innovation without compromising compliance or dependability.

Tools Empowering SRE at SAP:

Functionality

Tools & Solutions

Monitoring

Grafana, Dynatrace, Splunk, SAP BTP Monitoring & Alert Service

Ticketing

ServiceNow integrated with SAP Live Site status feeds

Automation

Ansible, SAP Automation Pilot, Terraform, SPC (Service Provider Cockpit)

Chaos Engineering

Chaos Monkey, SAP-internal fault injection setups

Security Ops & SIEM

Trend Micro EDR, Splunk SIEM, Log Forensics, File Integrity Monitoring

Log Management

Security Log Onboarding, User Activity Tracking, SAP Cloud Logging

SAP fosters resilience engineering through:

  • Adaptability: Systems auto-heal and re-route
  • Flexibility: Infrastructure scales predictably
  • Learning: RCA and past incidents improve future stability

To prepare systems, processes, and people—not to break things, but to identify weak points early—SRE techniques aggressively replicate "failure-in-production" scenarios.

SRE, which combines engineering discipline with trust, continuity, and security, is not merely a nice-to-have in the SAP cloud environment. Uptime is useless in today's cloud-native applications without protection.

SAP strives to ensure that its cloud services are always available and safe by integrating SRE thinking from the beginning.

 

References :

  1. SAP Product Standard Security – SAP Note 2253549

  2. SAP BTP Monitoring & Alerting – SAP Help: Alert Notification

  3. SAP Security Best Practices – SAP Community Security Topic

  4. Chaos Engineering Overview – Gremlin Chaos Engineering Guide

  5. SIEM in SAP (Security Monitoring) – SAP Help: Security Logging

  6. SAP Code Vulnerability Analyzer (CVA) – SAP Developer Tools

entry.title: Re: When deploying CAPM app in trial facing error; Insuff...
entry.content: Based on the observed behavior, it appears that the error is not directly attributable to Cloud Foundry's quota or memory limitations. My assessment is that the issue stems from memory exhaustion on the virtual machine hosting the trial account. This conclusion is supported by the fact that deployments are successful in the morning but consistently fail during the afternoon and evening. This pattern suggests that resource contention, likely due to increased user activity during peak hours, is the primary cause.

entry.title: BRF+ Object Creation using ABAP Z-Report, Part 2
entry.content:
To create BRF+ Elements programmatically using ABAP Refer Previous blog

BRF+ Object Creation using ABAP Z-Report

In this blog, we will learn how to create BRF+ Structures and Table type programmatically using ABAP. This provides a scalable way to automate the creation of data objects and integrate them into larger rule frameworks.

Structure Creation: The same application should be used to create the structure.
It is not necessary to build a structure if our result contains just one column. There is also no need to create a structure if the output for a single condition is a single row. If more than one column appears in our result, we should make a structure with all of those columns. Additionally, a structure must be shown if the output consists of multiple rows. 

Table type Creation: In order to have multiple result rows based on a single condition in our decision table, we can create a table in the same application. Therefore, table creation is necessary in our case.

ABAP Program to Create Structure and Table type

Below is a sample ABAP program (ZDEMO_BRF_APP) 

REPORT zdemo_brf_app.

DATA: lo_factory           TYPE REF TO if_fdt_factory,
      lo_application       TYPE REF TO if_fdt_application,
      lt_message           TYPE if_fdt_types=>t_message,
      lv_message           TYPE string,
      lv_boolean           TYPE abap_bool,
      lv_demo_appl_id      TYPE if_fdt_types=>id,
      lv_string            TYPE string,
      lo_element_1         TYPE REF TO if_fdt_element,
      lo_element_2         TYPE REF TO if_fdt_element,
      lo_element_3         TYPE REF TO if_fdt_element,
      lo_table             TYPE REF TO if_fdt_table,
      lo_table_1           TYPE REF TO if_fdt_table,
      lo_structure         TYPE REF TO if_fdt_structure,
      lv_element1_id       TYPE if_fdt_types=>id,
      lv_element2_id       TYPE if_fdt_types=>id,
      lv_element3_id       TYPE if_fdt_types=>id,
      lv_input_number_id   TYPE if_fdt_types=>id,
      lv_result_counter_id TYPE if_fdt_types=>id,
     

FIELD-SYMBOLS:
  <ls_message> TYPE if_fdt_types=>s_message,
  <lv_value>   TYPE any.


PARAMETERS: pv_lcl  TYPE abap_bool RADIOBUTTON GROUP r00 DEFAULT 'X',
            pv_sys  TYPE abap_bool RADIOBUTTON GROUP r00,
            pv_mstr TYPE abap_bool RADIOBUTTON GROUP r00,
            pv_name TYPE char30.
*           p_ele_01  TYPE i DEFAULT 5,
*            p_ele_02  TYPE i DEFAULT 4,
*            p_ele_03  TYPE i DEFAULT 8,
*            p_ele_04  TYPE i DEFAULT 3,
*            p_ele_05  TYPE i DEFAULT 13,
*            p_ele_06  TYPE i DEFAULT 2.
*           pv_ele   TYPE char20,
*           pv_str TYPE char20,
*           pv_tab TYPE char20.

IF pv_name IS NOT INITIAL AND pv_lcl IS NOT INITIAL OR pv_sys IS NOT INITIAL OR pv_mstr IS NOT INITIAL.

* get a reference to the instance of the factory
  lo_factory = cl_fdt_factory=>if_fdt_factory~get_instance( ).

* =============================================================
* definition of the new application:
* get an initial application object from the factory
  lo_application = lo_factory->get_application( ).
  lo_application->if_fdt_transaction~enqueue( ).
* set values for the application, especially the name is important
* You need to have a unique name for each application, here we use the
* FDT Service class method to get the unique name.
  lo_application->set_application_component( 'BC' ).        "#EC NOTEXT
  lo_application->set_software_component( 'SAP_BASIS' ).    "#EC NOTEXT
  lo_application->set_development_package( '$TMP' ).        "#EC NOTEXT
*lo_application->if_fdt_admin_data~set_name( cl_fdt_services=>get_unique_name( ) ).
  lo_application->if_fdt_admin_data~set_name( pv_name ).


* In FDT terms there are 3 different type of Applications, Local application,
* system pplication and MasterData Application. The following lines shows how you
* can create local Application, masterdata Application and system Application.
  IF pv_lcl EQ abap_true.
    lo_application->create_local_application( ).
  ELSEIF pv_sys EQ abap_true.
    lo_application->create_system_application( ).
  ELSEIF pv_mstr EQ abap_true.
    lo_application->create_masterdata_application( ).
  ENDIF.
  lo_application->if_fdt_transaction~activate(
             IMPORTING et_message           = lt_message
                       ev_activation_failed = lv_boolean ).
  IF lv_boolean EQ abap_true.
*     for some reason the activation failed -> individual handling needed
    lo_application->if_fdt_transaction~dequeue( ).
  ELSE.
    lo_application->if_fdt_transaction~save( ).
    lo_application->if_fdt_transaction~dequeue( ).
*     usually it makes sense to store the id for later access to the application
    lv_demo_appl_id = lo_application->mv_id.
  ENDIF.
  WRITE: 'The ID of the application created is: ', lv_demo_appl_id. "#EC NOTEXT
ELSE.
  MESSAGE 'Provide all the required information' TYPE 'E'.
ENDIF.
*for creating Element,Structure,Table by Data Object


lo_factory = cl_fdt_factory=>if_fdt_factory~get_instance( lv_demo_appl_id ).
* =============================================================
* definition of a data object structure:
* get an initial data object structure from the factory
lo_structure ?= lo_factory->get_data_object(
    iv_data_object_type = if_fdt_constants=>gc_data_object_type_structure ).
lo_structure->if_fdt_transaction~enqueue( ).
lo_structure->if_fdt_admin_data~set_name( 'STRUCTURE' ).
lo_structure->set_elements( lts_element ).
**********************************************************************************
* Alternately user can create a structure by using the service class method,
* CL_FDT_CONVENIENCE=>CREATE_STRUCTURE as follows.
* Cl_fdt_convenience=>create_structure( EXPORTING iv_name = 'DEMO_STRUCTURE_1'
*                                                iv_application_id = if_fdt_constants=>gc_application_tmp
*                                                it_element        =  lts_element
*                                                iv_activate       = ABAP_false
*                                      IMPORTING
*                                                eo_structure      = lo_structure ).
***********************************************************************************

lo_structure->if_fdt_transaction~activate(
  IMPORTING
    et_message           = lt_message
    ev_activation_failed = lv_boolean ).


IF lv_boolean EQ abap_true.
  LOOP AT lt_message ASSIGNING <ls_message>.
    MESSAGE ID <ls_message>-msgid TYPE <ls_message>-msgty NUMBER <ls_message>-msgno
        WITH <ls_message>-msgv1 <ls_message>-msgv2 <ls_message>-msgv3 <ls_message>-msgv4
        INTO lv_message.
  ENDLOOP.
  WRITE : lv_message.
*         for some reason the activation failed -> individual handling needed
  lo_structure->if_fdt_transaction~dequeue( ).
ELSE.
  lo_structure->if_fdt_transaction~save( ).
  lo_structure->if_fdt_transaction~dequeue( ).
*         usually it makes sense to store the id for later access to the application
  lv_structure_id = lo_structure->mv_id.
ENDIF.
*   WRITE: / lo_structure->mv_id .
lv_string = lo_structure->if_fdt_admin_data~to_string(  iv_mode = if_fdt_constants=>gc_tostring_mode_complete ).
WRITE : / 'The result of to string method call Structure: ' , lv_string. "#EC NOTEXT
* =============================================================
* definition of a data object table:
*     get an initial data object Table from the factory
lo_table ?= lo_factory->get_data_object(
    iv_data_object_type = if_fdt_constants=>gc_data_object_type_table ).
lo_table->if_fdt_transaction~enqueue( ).
lo_table->if_fdt_admin_data~set_name( 'TABLE' ).
lo_table->set_structure( lv_structure_id ).
INSERT lo_table->mv_id INTO TABLE lts_context_id.
***********************************************************************
* Alternately user can create a Table by using the service class method,
* CL_FDT_CONVENIENCE=>CREATE_TABLE as follows.
* cl_fdt_convenience=>create_table( EXPORTING iv_name = 'DEMO_TABLE_1'
*                                            iv_structure_name = 'DEMO_STRUCTURE_1'
*                                            iv_application_id = if_fdt_constants=>gc_application_tmp
*                                            it_element        = its_element
*                                            iv_activate       = ABAP_false
*                                  IMPORTING
*                                            eo_table          = lo_table ).
***********************************************************************



lo_table->if_fdt_transaction~activate(
  IMPORTING
    et_message           = lt_message
    ev_activation_failed = lv_boolean ).
IF lv_boolean EQ abap_true.
*        for some reason the activation failed -> individual handling needed
  lo_table->if_fdt_transaction~dequeue( ).
ELSE.
  lo_table->if_fdt_transaction~save( ).
  lo_table->if_fdt_transaction~dequeue( ).
*        usually it makes sense to store the id for later access to the application

ENDIF.
*   WRITE: / lo_table->mv_id .
lv_string = lo_table->if_fdt_admin_data~to_string(  iv_mode = if_fdt_constants=>gc_tostring_mode_complete ).
WRITE : / 'The result of to_string method call Table: ' , lv_string. "#EC NOTEXT


* cl_fdt_convenience=>create_table( EXPORTING iv_application_id = if_fdt_constants=>gc_application_tmp
*                                                iv_element_type   = if_fdt_constants=>gc_data_object_type_table
*                                                iv_activate       = abap_false
*                                                iv_name           = 'RESULT_COUNTER'
*                                      IMPORTING eo_element        = lo_result_counter ).
*
*  INSERT lo_result_counter->mv_id INTO TABLE lts_context_id.
*TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_element ,
*  name TYPE if_fdt_types=>name,
*  lv_element type if_fdt_types=>element_type,
*  END OF ty_element.
*DATA: lt_element TYPE TABLE OF ty_element,
*      lss_element TYPE ty_element.
*  lss_element-name = 'SFLIGHT_TAB'.
*  lss_element-lv_element = if_fdt_constants=>gc_data_object_type_table.
*  APPEND lss_element TO lt_element.


lo_table_1 ?= lo_factory->get_data_object(
    iv_data_object_type = if_fdt_constants=>gc_data_object_type_table ).
lo_table_1->if_fdt_transaction~enqueue( ).
lo_table_1->if_fdt_admin_data~set_name( 'SFLIGHT_TAB' ).
lo_table_1->set_structure( lv_result_table_id ).
APPEND lo_table_1->mv_id TO lts_context_id.

lo_table_1->if_fdt_transaction~activate(
  IMPORTING
    et_message           = lt_message
    ev_activation_failed = lv_boolean ).
IF lv_boolean EQ abap_true.
*        for some reason the activation failed -> individual handling needed
  lo_table_1->if_fdt_transaction~dequeue( ).
ELSE.
  lo_table_1->if_fdt_transaction~save( ).
  lo_table_1->if_fdt_transaction~dequeue( ).
*        usually it makes sense to store the id for later access to the application

ENDIF.
*   WRITE: / lo_table->mv_id .
lv_string = lo_table_1->if_fdt_admin_data~to_string(  iv_mode = if_fdt_constants=>gc_tostring_mode_complete ).
WRITE : / 'The result of to_string method call Table: ' , lv_string. "#EC NOTEXT

*
*  cl_fdt_convenience=>create_table(
*    EXPORTING
*      iv_name           =  'RESULT_TABLE'                " Name
*      iv_structure_name = lv_name
*      iv_application_id = if_fdt_constants=>gc_application_tmp                " Universal Unique Identifier
*      it_element        = lt_element              " Elements
*      iv_activate       = abap_true        " Activate changes?
*    IMPORTING
**      ev_table_id       =                  " Universal Unique Identifier
*      eo_table          = lo_result_table                " FDT: Data Object of Type Table
*  ).
*  CATCH cx_fdt_input. " FDT: Invalid Input

Execution & Output

When you execute the above ABAP report, the newly created Application , Structure and Table  will immediately be reflected in the BRF+ Workbench (/nBRF+). You can navigate to the workbench to verify that the application ZDEMO_APP and its elements have been created successfully.

After running the program, you will see system-generated IDs for each element created. These IDs are crucial when referencing the elements in Structures, Rules, or Functions.

 

Conclusion

In the next part of this blog series, we will explore how to create DB Lookup, Loop, Formula, Rule, and Function in Subsequent blogs in detail.

entry.title: How to Track Data Changes and Change Log Mechanism in RAP.
entry.content:
Hi,

A change log table is a simple yet effective way to track data modifications without storing the complete historical snapshots of records. While the main table continues to hold only the active business data, the change log table captures essential metadata such as the record identifiers, type of change, user, and reason for the update. In a RAP scenario, determinations during the save sequence record these details before the final commit, ensuring a reliable audit trail. This approach not only supports compliance monitoring, reporting, and troubleshooting but also minimizes storage and performance overhead compared to maintaining full shadow tables.

Here we see some major key Advantages. 

  • Simplified Design – Only one additional table is needed, making the data model and maintenance simpler. 
  • Faster Reporting on Changes – The log contains concise, relevant details, making it easier to query and generate audit reports. 
  • Regulatory Compliance – Still fulfills many compliance and audit requirements by showing who changed what and when. 

Steps to achieving  the Track Change Log Mechanism in RAP

I have create 2 database tables  

  1. For basic details 
  2. Capturing the changes record table 
@EndUserText.label : 'log chanes' 

@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE 

@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT 

@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A 

@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #RESTRICTED 

define table zgiri_t_emp_det { 
key id : abap.int8 not null; 

name : abap.char(30); 

department : abap.char(30); 

curr_key : abap.cuky; 

@Semantics.amount.currencyCode : ' zgiri_t_emp_det.curr_key' 

salary : abap.curr(15,2); 

created_by : syuname; 

created_at : timestampl; 

changed_by : syuname; 

changed_at :timestampl; 

}

Table 2. 

@EndUserText.label : 'log chanes' 

@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE 

@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT 

@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A 

@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #RESTRICTED 

define table zgiri_t_ch_log1 { 

key id : abap.int8 not null; 

name : abap.char(30); 

old_value : abap.string(0); 

new_value : abap.string(0); 

changed_by : syuname; 

changed_at : timestampl; 

}

Step2. 

We have to create root view  on top of the database table. 

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE] 

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED 

@EndUserText.label: 'employee details' 

@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true 

@ObjectModel.usageType:{ 

serviceQuality: #X, 

sizeCategory: #S, 

dataClass: #MIXED 

} 

define view entity zgiri_i_empl1_details as select from ZGIRI_T_emp_det 

association [0..*] to zgiri_i_ch_log1 as _change on _change.id = $projection.id 

{ 

key id as Id, 

name as Name, 

department as Department, 

curr_key as CurrKey, 

@semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'CurrKey' 

salary as Salary, 

created_by as CreatedBy, 

created_at as CreatedAt, 

changed_by as ChangedBy, 

changed_at as ChangedAt, 

_change 

}

Then we have to create data definition for change log also. 

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE] 

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED 

@EndUserText.label: 'employee details' 

@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true 

@ObjectModel.usageType:{ 

serviceQuality: #X, 

sizeCategory: #S, 

dataClass: #MIXED 

} 

define view entity zgiri_i_empl1_details as select from zgiri_i_ch_log1 

association [1..1] to zgiri_i_emp_det as _emp on _change.id = $projection.id 

{ 

key id as Id, 

field_name as Field_name, 

old_value as OldValue, 

new_value as NewValue, 

created_by as CreatedBy, 

_emp 

}

 

Step 3. 

for the basic data definition we have create on metadata extension for front end display. 

@Metadata.layer:#CORE 

annotate entity zgiri_i_empl_details 

with  

{ 

@UI.facet: [  

{  

id: 'object', 

label: 'Basic Data', 

type: #IDENTIFICATION_REFERENCE, 

purpose: #STANDARD, 

position: 10 }] 

 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'Id' , position: 10 }] 

@UI.identification: [{ label: 'Id' , position: 10 }] 

Id; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'Name' , position: 20 }] 

@UI.identification: [{ label: 'Name' , position: 20 }] 

Name; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'Department' , position: 30 }] 

@UI.identification : [{ label: 'Department' , position: 30 }] 

Department; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'CurrKey' , position: 40 }] 

@UI.identification : [{ label: 'CurrKey' , position: 40 }] 

CurrKey; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'Salary' , position: 50 }] 

@UI.identification : [{ label: 'Salary' , position: 50 }] 

Salary; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'CreatedBy' , position: 60 }] 

CreatedBy; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'CreatedAt' , position: 70 }] 

CreatedAt; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'ChangedBy' , position: 80 }] 

ChangedBy; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'ChangedAt' , position: 90 }] 

ChangedAt; 

}

Step 4. 

On top of the basic view we have to behavior definition. 

managed implementation in class zbp_giri_i_empl_details unique; 

strict ( 2 ); 

define behavior for zgiri_i_empl_details //alias <alias_name> 

persistent table zgiri_t_emp_det 

lock master 

with additional save 

authorization master ( instance ) 

early numbering 

//etag master <field_name> 

{ 

create ( authorization : global ); 

update; 

delete; 

field ( readonly ) Id; 

mapping for zgiri_t_emp_det 

{ 

ChangedAt = changed_at; 

ChangedBy = changed_by; 

CreatedAt = created_at; 

CreatedBy = created_by; 

CurrKey = curr_key; 

Department = department; 

Id = id; 

Name = name; 

Salary = salary; 

} 

}

 

On top the consumption view i have create behavior definition for consumption view. 

 

projection; 

strict ( 2 ); 

define behavior for zgiri_c_empl //alias <alias_name> 

{ 

use create; 

use update; 

use delete; 

}

I'm implementing logic in this class. 

CLASS lsc_zgiri_i_empl_details DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_saver. 

PROTECTED SECTION. 

METHODS save_modified REDEFINITION. 

ENDCLASS. 

CLASS lsc_zgiri_i_empl_details IMPLEMENTATION. 

METHOD save_modified. 

DATA lt_log TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zgiri_t_ch_logs1. 

DATA lt_log1 TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zgiri_t_ch_logs1. 


IF update-zgiri_i_empl_details iS NOT INITIAL. 

lt_log = CORRESPONDING #( update-zgiri_i_empl_details ). 

LOOP AT update-zgiri_i_empl_details ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_log_update>). 

ASSIGN lt_log[ id = <ls_log_update>-Id ] TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_log_u>) .  

* / NAME UPDATE......................................... 

if <ls_log_update>-%control-Name = if_abap_behv=>mk-on. 

<ls_log_u>-name = <ls_log_update>-Name. 

 TRY. 

<ls_log_u>-id = cl_system_uuid=>create_uuid_x16_static( ). 

CATCH cx_uuid_error. 

"handle exception 

ENDTRY. 

APPEND <ls_log_u> TO lt_log1. 


ENDIF. 

ENDLOOP. 
INSERT zgiri_t_ch_logs1 FROM TABLE _log1. 

ENDIF. 
ENDMETHOD. 
ENDCLASS. 

CLASS lhc_zgiri_i_empl_details DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_handler. 

PUBLIC SECTION. 

PRIVATE SECTION. 
METHODS get_instance_authorizations FOR INSTANCE AUTHORIZATION 

IMPORTING keys REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR zgiri_i_empl_details RESULT result. 

METHODS get_global_authorizations FOR GLOBAL AUTHORIZATION 

IMPORTING REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR zgiri_i_empl_details RESULT result. 

METHODS earlynumbering_create FOR NUMBERING 

IMPORTING entities FOR CREATE zgiri_i_empl_details. 

ENDCLASS. 

CLASS lhc_zgiri_i_empl_details IMPLEMENTATION. 

METHOD get_instance_authorizations. 

ENDMETHOD. 

METHOD get_global_authorizations. 

ENDMETHOD. 

METHOD earlynumbering_create. 

DATA(lt_entities) = entities. 

DELETE lt_entities WHERE Id IS NOT INITIAL. 

TRY. 

cl_numberrange_runtime=>number_get( 

EXPORTING 

nr_range_nr = '01' 

object = '/DMO/TRV_M' 

quantity = CONV #( lines( lt_entities ) ) 

IMPORTING 

number = DATA(lv_latest_num) 

returncode = DATA(lv_code) 

returned_quantity = DATA(lv_qty) 

). 

CATCH cx_nr_object_not_found. 

CATCH cx_number_ranges INTO DATA(lo_error). 

LOOP AT lt_entities INTO DATA(ls_entities). 

APPEND VALUE #( %cid = ls_entities-%cid 

%key = ls_entities-%key ) 

TO failed-zgiri_i_empl_details. 

APPEND VALUE #( %cid = ls_entities-%cid 

%key = ls_entities-%key 

%msg = lo_error ) 

TO reported-zgiri_i_empl_details. 

ENDLOOP. 

EXIT. 

ENDTRY. 

ASSERT lv_qty = lines( lt_entities ). 

* DATA: lt_travel_tech_m TYPE TABLE FOR MAPPED EARLY yi_travel_tech_m, 

* ls_travel_tech_m LIKE LINE OF lt_travel_tech_m. 

DATA(lv_curr_num) = lv_latest_num - lv_qty. 

LOOP AT lt_entities INTO ls_entities. 

lv_curr_num = lv_curr_num + 1. 

 APPEND VALUE #( %cid = ls_entities-%cid 

ID = lv_curr_num ) 

TO mapped-zgiri_i_empl_details. 

ENDLOOP. 

ENDMETHOD. 

ENDCLASS.

 

On top the behavior definition we have to create service definition. 

@EndUserText.label: 'service definition' 

define service Zgiri_rap_scn_ser { 

expose zgiri_i_empl_details; 

}

On top the service definition we have to create  service binding.

 

after that we can preview our application.

Im taking name as example im going to update the name sham signiwis this value.  

see we can update shyam prasad.

And we see in the chang log table. 

thank you 
if u have any query reach out me

entry.title: MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2 badi not triggering for PR Approval in SAP PUBLIC CLOUD
entry.content:
Hi Team,

ERP Type: SA PUBLIC CLOUD

I have created Custom Workflow in "Manage Workflow for Purchase Requisitions". Used Agent Determination by BAdi in Steps. Created Implementation for MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2 with filter of BusinessContext CS "PurchaseRequistion" and written business logic too. Whenever I am trying to Create PR through, "Create Purchase Requisition - Advanced" PR getting created without triggering workflow implementation. In header I have seen messages like:

Recipient role with id '/RULE/MMPUR_PR_BD_AGNT' cannot be resolved

 

I tried to debug business logic in implementation, Even debugger also not getting created, so i confirmed that Badi itself is not getting called. what's the actual way to achieve this.

DATA: ls_badi_approver TYPE if_mmpur_workflow_agents_v2=>bd_mmpur_s_badi_approver,
lt_badi_approver TYPE if_mmpur_workflow_agents_v2=>bd_mmpur_t_badi_approver,
ls_previous_approver TYPE if_mmpur_workflow_agents_v2=>bd_mmpur_s_previous_approver,
ls_new_approver TYPE if_mmpur_workflow_agents_v2=>bd_mmpur_s_badi_approver.

DATA: lv_level TYPE i.
DATA: lv_previousstep TYPE i.

IF businessobject CS 'PurchaseRequisition'.
SELECT SINGLE Plant FROM i_purchaserequisitionitemapi01 INTO @DATA(lv_prplant)
WHERE purchaserequisition = @purchasingdocument AND PurchaseRequisitionItem = @purchasingdocumentitem.
IF sy-subrc EQ '0'.
SELECT *
FROM YY1_PR_XXXX_APPROVER
INTO TABLE @DATA(lt_Approvers)
WHERE Plant = @LV_prplant.
IF sy-subrc EQ '0'.
IF stepinfo-totalsteps = 2.
IF stepinfo-currentstep = 1.
DATA(lv_l1approver) = VALUE #( lt_Approvers[ Plant = lv_prplant ]-L1_Approver OPTIONAL ).
ls_new_approver-businessuser = lv_l1approver.
APPEND ls_new_approver-businessuser TO approverlist.
ELSEIF stepinfo-currentstep = 2.
DATA(lv_l2approver) = VALUE #( lt_Approvers[ Plant = lv_prplant ]-L2_Approver OPTIONAL ).
ls_new_approver-businessuser = lv_l2approver.
APPEND ls_new_approver-businessuser TO approverlist.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.

LOOP AT previousapproverlist INTO ls_previous_approver.
READ TABLE lt_badi_approver INTO ls_badi_approver
WITH KEY businessuser = ls_previous_approver-businessuser.
CHECK sy-subrc = 0.
DELETE lt_badi_approver WHERE approvallevel = ls_badi_approver-approvallevel.
ENDLOOP.

SAP Workflow Management  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition SAP Business Workflow

entry.title: SAP Build Apps – Deep Insert & Minimal Payload with S/4HANA OData (Create Inbound Deliveries)
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I’m working on a scenario where SAP Build Apps connects to an S/4HANA OData service (API_INBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV/A_InbDeliveryHeader). The goal is to create inbound deliveries from Build Apps with a minimal payload and include line items via a deep entity (to_DeliveryDocumentItem).

Challenge:

Create Record node

  • Forces mapping of all ~107 fields of the header entity, even if only 2–3 fields are needed.
  • Does not expose navigation properties (deep entities) for mapping.

HTTP Destination Request

  • Facing issues with endpoint resolution.
  • The relative path seems to end up in the request body instead of the URL.
  • Calls return 400 Bad Request.

Example payload I tried (items only):

 

{
  "to_DeliveryDocumentItem": {
    "results": [
      {
        "ActualDeliveryQuantity": "1000",
        "ReferenceSDDocument": "4500000763",
        "ReferenceSDDocumentItem": "10"
      },
      {
        "ActualDeliveryQuantity": "800",
        "ReferenceSDDocument": "4500000763",
        "ReferenceSDDocumentItem": "20"
      }
    ]
  }
}

 

Questions

  1. Is it a known limitation that Create Record does not support deep entities or minimal payloads?

  2. What is the recommended approach in Build Apps for:

    • Deep insert (header + items)

    • Partial updates (sending only required fields)

  3. For HTTP Destination Request, where should the relative path be set so it becomes config.url instead of being placed inside the body?

  4. Does the inbound delivery API support POST with deep entities, and what are the minimum required header fields?

  5. Any specifics to consider (e.g., $batch, sap-client, CSRF token handling)?

If anyone has a working example (endpoint + headers + minimal payload), it would be very helpful.

Thanks in advance for your guidance!

Best regards,
Aman K.

entry.title: Re: How to enable caching for SAP OData V2?
entry.content:
I am on ABAP >=7.52, but it don't see how the class can be used without major adaptation.

  1. Cache support class doesn't affect building of cache keys at all
  2. /ui2/if_cache_support_2=>invalidate_cache is called, but only provided entity_set name - this is not enough to rebuild the cache key for the current request, so how can this even be used?
  3. /ui2/cl_cache_handler=>get is called with "expiry_secs". If this was customizable, it would work great! But it is hardcoded as -1..

Thus, I don't see any way to customize caching behaviour of this class without reimplementation as of now, which is a shame, because it looks like a nice utility for caching that is just missing some places to hook in custom behaviour (e.g. via cache support class construct, imagine if we had all params to determine expiry_secs dynamically here..). Maybe I am missing something or this class is not intended the way I want to use it, best regards

Eduard

entry.title: Re: Revenue posting for Usage based billing
entry.content:
Hello @sheetalsethiya22 

Revenue is not posted immediately upon creating the usage-based billing document. Instead, it is processed through Event-Based Revenue Recognition (EBRR). You should run the EBRR job and review the postings in Display Journal Entries to verify.

SAP Help Event-Based Revenue Recognition - Projects

SAP Best Practice 1A8 – Project Billing (Usage-Based & Time & Expense)

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Mass activation of ICF services
entry.content:
Disclaimer: that's a copy of the below blog post, not authored by me, because the original formatting has a blank page and screenshots are truncated:

Mass activation of Service ICF - SAP Community.

All credits go to the original author.

<START>

SAP Basis Administrator always face problem in activating ICF services in mass and in sync with other systems in the landscape, mostly after a new system build or new installation or sometime after system refreshed / client copy as well. This is a general problem and always trouble a lot. Normally we do it manually which takes a lot of time. Here is my blog which will help you to overcome this problem and allow you to activate/deactivate ICF services in mass which will take hardly 2 minutes to perform the task. Though the verification is always recommended.

SAP provides two reports RS_ICF_SERV_ADMIN_TASKS (export to CSV) and RS_ICF_SERV_MASS_PROCESSING (import from CSV) which does all the tricks for us. However, it is important to note how to use these reports. Importantly the second one otherwise you might mess up the system by deactivating all the services at once. Below you will find step by step pictorial blog to make your work easy.

So let's start.

Execute SA38 or SE38 and provide report name RS_ICF_SERV_ADMIN_TASKS

 


Select option export active services to CSV file

 

Provide file location and file name

 

File will be created at specified location. File format will be CSV

 

All active services exported inside excel sheet

 

Deactivated services in target system

 

CSV file having these services

 

Execute SA38 and provide report name RS_ICF_SERV_MASS_PROESSING

 

Select the option as shown in the picture and execute

 

Select Yes

 

Upload the file and execute

 

Result of successful activation

 

All services in the CSV file will be activated in target system

 


Conclusion:

By performing these activities, it will make Basis administration task of activating SICF will easy and save lots of time for them. Normally, activating services manually takes hours, however, doing this way it will take a few minutes to perform the same task.

THE END

Disclaimer: that's a copy of the below blog post, not authored by me, because the original formatting has a blank page and screenshots are truncated:

Mass activation of Service ICF - SAP Community.

All credits go to the original author.

entry.title: Call for Community Talk Speakers! Step into the Spotlight at SAP TechEd on Tour – Bangalore 2025
entry.content:
Hello SAP community enthusiasts! 

 Are you passionate about sharing your knowledge and experiences with fellow tech-savvy individuals attending SAP TechEd on Tour? Do you have innovative ideas or insights into SAP technologies that you think could benefit others? If so, here's an exciting opportunity for you to shine!  

We are offering Community Talks, which are 20-minutes session slots, to be filled by community members to share their knowledge with the community onsite at SAP TechEd on Tour in Bangalore. Sign up as Community Talk speaker for our much-anticipated event taking place on November 25-26, 2025! 

As a Community Talk Speaker you’ll get a “Lecture-Only” ticket to attend SAP TechEd. Travel and Expenses are not covered by SAP.

Why Participate as a Community Talk Speaker? 

As a speaker at SAP TechEd, you'll be at the forefront of inspiring and engaging with technical professionals, developers, and business leaders. It's a unique opportunity to: 

  • Showcase Your Expertise: Share your unique insights, experiences, and innovations with a diverse audience. Hands-on, demos, presentations, anything that helps your audience to learn from your session is welcome. 
  • Network and Collaborate: Connect with other SAP professionals, enthusiasts, and thought leaders from around the globe in the Community Theatre at SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore. 
  • Expand Your Reach: Gain visibility in the SAP ecosystem and establish yourself as a go-to expert in your field. 

Topics to Consider 

We're looking for presentations on a wide range of topics that resonate with SAP TechEd's core focus areas. There are nine content tracks, please have a look at all of them on the SAP TechEd Event Website. These include (but are not limited to): 

  • Application Development and Automation 
  • Business Transformation Management 
  • AI and machine learning applications in SAP such as Business AI and Joule 
  • Breakthroughs in data management and analytics 
  • Integration 
  • Cloud Applications  

If you have a creative idea that pushes the boundaries of what's possible with SAP, we'd love to hear about it! 

Important Dates and Deadlines: 

To ensure you don't miss out, please keep an eye on the following important dates: 

  • Deadline for Speaker Applications and your Session Submissions: October 10, 2025 
  • Notification of Acceptance: October 17, 2025 
  • Final Presentation Submission for review: November 10, 2025 (if you don’t intend to have a presentation for your session, even better!) 
  • Date of the event: November 25-26, 2025 (ensure to be available on both days until the Community Talks schedule is finalized) 

How to Apply 

Think you're ready to take the stage? Here’s how you can apply: 

  1. Prepare Your Proposal: Outline the main points and objectives of your talk. Make sure it aligns with this year’s focus areas (see SAP TechEd Event Website for content tracks) and is tech-content (it should not be marketing products, services or companies).  Again, hands-on-style, demos, presentations, anything that helps your audience to learn from your session is welcome. 
  2. Submit Your Application: Write an email to us and complete the email with all session details. Use this mailto link as it is prepared with all details for your convenience.  
  3. Document Your Passion: Highlight your enthusiasm and experience with SAP solutions—include any previous speaking engagements or relevant achievements. You’re very welcome to share an abstract of your session here in community.sap.com and gain feedback and reputation as a fellow community member.  

Join us in Bangalore! 

Let's make this year's conference inspirational and groundbreaking together. We can’t wait to hear your stories, ideas, and innovations. Join us and become an integral part of the SAP Community! 

Feel free to share this opportunity with your colleagues and networks who may be interested in speaking or attending. Together, let’s continue to push the boundaries of technology and innovation. 

We look forward to seeing you at SAP TechEd on Tour in Bangalore!

entry.title: Re: Issue Connecting Power BI to SAP CDS View via OData Feed
entry.content:
Hi @taher123 ,

The Power BI error message basically means the OData feed from SAP isn’t authenticating with the credentials you’re giving it.
Here’s how to troubleshoot and what you can reply on the forum:

Likely Causes

  1. Anonymous Access Blocked:
    SAP OData services (especially CDS-based) don’t allow anonymous access by default. Power BI is trying with “Anonymous” mode.

  2. Wrong Authentication Method in Power BI:
    You need to use either Basic (username/password) or Organizational Account (SAML/SSO) depending on how your Gateway is configured.

  3. No HTTPS / Self-Signed Certificate Issue:
    Your URL is using HTTP on port 18020. Power BI may reject or require manual approval for an untrusted endpoint. So try https host. Check with your SAP BASIS team to get the correct https URL.

  4. Missing CORS or Network Reachability:
    Power BI desktop must reach your SAP Gateway host and port. Check firewall / VPN access. Check this with your SAP and network team.

    Regards,
    Sudheer.
